definitions.definition: Three monstrous giants of enormous size and strength, each with fifty heads and one hundred arms, who were offspring of Uranus by Gaia , whom Zeus freed from captivity and who in return aided the Olympians in the Titanomachy .
examples: The three Hecatoncheires were named Cottus , Briareus (or Aegaeon) and Gyges (or Gyes).

main_definition: ( Greek mythology ) Three monstrous giants of enormous size and strength, each with fifty heads and one hundred arms, who were offspring of Uranus by Gaia , whom Zeus freed from captivity and who in return aided the Olympians in the Titanomachy .
